DOC.HEAD: Two Sentenced to Life for Killing Man Who Played Radio Too Loud
DOC.TEXT: Two men face life in prison for fatally beating a 25-year-old man during an arugument that began over the victim playing his radio too loud. Alex Abdalla Sr., 47, and Juan Rosado, 19, must serve at least 30 years before they can be eligible for parole. During sentencing Thursday, Superior Court Judge Barnett Hoffman said the pair acted like ``a bunch of jackals attacking a carcass.'' Hoffman said they beat and kicked Mario Santos, 25, although he lay unconscious on the ground. Abdalla and Rosado were convicted Oct. 6 of beating Santos in the parking lot of a New Brunswick housing complex during a dispute that began when Abdalla told Santos to turn down the volume of radio, said Middlesex County Assistant Prosecutor William Fetky. The two men argued and Santos was hit repeatedly by Abdalla, and Alex Abdalla Jr., 17, who joined his father, Fetky said. As Santos was leaving, Rosado kicked him in the face and Abdalla Sr. beat him with a metal spring while he lay unconscious on the ground, Fetky said. Abdalla Jr., who was 16 at the time of the August 1988 beating, pleaded guilty to juvenile delinquency in the case. He was sentenced Oct. 12 and is serving up to four years in juvenile custody.
